dt: {bc}to advance in station, rank, or honor {bc}{sx|raise||}
{bc}to change (a pawn) into a piece in chess by moving to the eighth rank
{bc}to advance (a student) from one grade to the next higher grade
{bc}to contribute to the growth or prosperity of {bc}{sx|further||}
{bc}to help bring (something, such as an enterprise) into being {bc}{sx|launch||}
{bc}to present (merchandise) for buyer acceptance through advertising, publicity, or discounting
{bc}to get possession of by doubtful means or by ingenuity

pt: {sc}advance{/sc} {sc}promote{/sc} {sc}forward{/sc} {sc}further{/sc} mean to help (someone or something) to move ahead. {sc}advance{/sc} stresses effective assisting in hastening a process or bringing about a desired end.
{sc}promote{/sc} suggests an encouraging or fostering and may denote an increase in status or rank.
{sc}forward{/sc} implies an impetus forcing something ahead.
{sc}further{/sc} suggests a removing of obstacles in the way of a desired advance.

pt.t: used the marriage to {it}further{/it} his career

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}promotus{/it}, past participle of {it}promovēre{/it}, literally, to move forward, from {it}pro-{/it} forward + {it}movēre{/it} to move
shortdef: to advance in station, rank, or honor : raise
to change (a pawn) into a piece in chess by moving to the eighth rank
to advance (a student) from one grade to the next higher grade

dt: {bc}to advertise or publicize (something, such as a product or service) by means of another product, service, etc.

dt.t: When he launches a new website this summer … he'll {wi}cross-promote{/wi} his jewelry, fragrance and clothes.

This February, the retailer will be {wi}cross promoting{/wi} chocolate truffles with champagne as it has in the past. … {ldquo}It's a romantic end-of-the-meal type thing for two people. We put a little kit together, and that's really popular,{rdquo} [Rick] Vernon said.

Work with a group in your area to {wi}cross-promote{/wi} a mutually beneficial event. Maybe your company is sponsoring a gala for the local animal shelter. By working with a nonprofit, you not only give back to the community but you expose your business to potential subscribers.
{ldquo}One of the advantages and abilities that we have is the ability to {wi}cross-promote{/wi},{rdquo} says Jeff Zucker, president of the NBC Universal Television Group.

shortdef: to advertise or publicize (something, such as a product or service) by means of another product, service, etc.
